messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2209
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2002 6:16:10 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Sheila, my hubby has thought this way for a long time.... I am beginning, but have to get rid
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2002 6:16:10 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I just don't like religion at all. I believe that the institutional
> church, with all it's offices and hierarchy and building programs and
> hypocracy is NOT what God intended. I do love Jesus, though. :)
>
> Sheila
>

Sheila, my hubby has thought this way for a long time.... I am beginning, but
have to get rid of all the brainwashing......
I am finding myself having to admit he's right.....that's so hard...... since
I always fight tooth and nail cause I'm right the majority of the
time....it's hard giving him that 1 percent...LOL

Kim


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2209
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2002 6:16:10 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I definitely agree Tuck........ I just can t understand why they leave it.....afterall you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2002 6:16:10 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I guess my point is....if you do have your wood pre-cut at the store,
> take it all with you if you paid for the whole piece! lol.
>
> Tuck
>

I definitely agree Tuck........ I just can't understand why they leave
it.....afterall you paid for.... I guess I am not the only ones.....the guys
that precut don't understand it either, but they just do the cutting and if
they customer's don't want what they paid for, they are happy to resale it
and make a profit....LOL

Kim
